job_description:
Content QA Specialist

Way.Com India Pvt Ltd is seeking a detail-oriented and quality-obsessed Content QA Specialist to join our high-performing content team. You will be the final quality gatekeeper, ensuring all published content meets the highest standards of accuracy, SEO effectiveness, compliance, and brand consistency.

Key Responsibilities:

Content Review & Editorial Consistency

  • Audit articles, blog posts, and landing pages for grammar, clarity, tone, and brand voice alignment.
  • Identify and fix issues such as awkward phrasing, factual inaccuracies, formatting errors, and general editorial inconsistencies.

SEO & Content Quality Validation

  • Review on-page SEO components including meta tags, header structure, keyword placement, and internal linking for accuracy and impact.
  • Evaluate content for originality, depth, and relevance, flagging material that lacks value or user-centric insights.

AI & Plagiarism Detection

  • Identify AI-generated or machine-written content using manual techniques and detection tools.
  • Conduct plagiarism checks to ensure content authenticity and compliance with ethical and brand guidelines.

EEAT Compliance & Credibility Assessment

  • Verify author credentials and assess the credibility of cited sources.
  • Ensure factual accuracy and authoritative tone, particularly for YMYL (Your Money or Your Life) categories such as finance, health, and legal topics.

Quality Assurance & Process Optimization

  • Maintain and refine QA checklists and content benchmarks in line with industry best practices.
  • Provide constructive feedback to writers and editors to promote editorial excellence and continuous improvement.

Preferred Skills/Requirements:

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in content quality assurance, editing, or SEO
  • Exceptional manual editing skills with strong attention to detail
  • Solid understanding of SEO fundamentals and Google’s content quality guidelines
  • Proven ability to identify AI-generated content and assess it for human readability
  • Proficient in using tools such as Grammarly, Copyscape, Copyleaks, Originality.ai, or similar alternatives
  • Skilled at identifying low-value or thin content and providing actionable improvement recommendations
  • Comfortable operating in a high-volume, fast-paced content production environment

Nice to Have:

  • Educational or professional background in journalism, digital marketing, or technical writing
  • Experience working with content management systems like WordPress
  • Familiarity with structured data, Yoast SEO plugin, and content scoring tools
  • Understanding of content compliance processes and fact-checking workflows

Contact Information: careers@way.com

Way Dot Com (P) Ltd Way.Com India Pvt Ltd, 4th Floor, Yamuna, Technopark Phase-III, Thiruvananthapuram , 695583
summary: Way.Com is looking for a Content QA Specialist to ensure high standards of content accuracy and SEO effectiveness. The role involves content review, AI detection, and quality process optimization.

job_description:
Senior QA Automation Engineer

Way Dot Com (P) Ltd is seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Senior QA Automation Engineer with a strong background in Java-based test automation. The ideal candidate should have 5+ years of experience in building and maintaining scalable automation frameworks, with expertise in Core Java, Selenium WebDriver, and REST API testing using Rest Assured.

This role requires a strategic mindset, the ability to translate complex business needs into effective testing solutions, and strong collaboration skills with cross-functional teams. Success in this position hinges on technical proficiency, clear communication, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Translate complex business requirements into comprehensive test strategies and detailed test plans.
  • Design, build, and maintain scalable and reusable test automation frameworks using Java.
  • Collaborate with product managers, developers, and QA teams to ensure end-to-end quality across the software development lifecycle.
  • Execute full end-to-end functional testing to validate system behavior and align with business goals.
  • Develop and maintain automated test scripts for web applications and APIs using Selenium WebDriver and Rest Assured.
  • Integrate automated test suites into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins) to enable continuous testing and rapid deployments.
  • Monitor, diagnose, and troubleshoot automation issues, delivering timely and actionable feedback to development teams.
  • Uphold high standards in test case design, automation code quality, and QA documentation.
  • Analyze test results, log and track defects, and collaborate with developers for swift and effective resolution.

Preferred Skills:

  • 5+ years of experience in test automation using Java.
  • Strong knowledge of Core Java, including object-oriented principles, exception handling, multi-threading, and file handling.
  • Proficiency in Java Collections (Lists, Sets, Maps, Queues) and solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
  • Hands-on experience with Selenium WebDriver, including dynamic element handling, custom wait strategies, and cross-browser compatibility.
  • Proficient in REST API testing using Rest Assured, covering request modeling, authentication, and API validation.
  • Experience with Jenkins or similar CI/CD tools for test suite integration and automation pipeline maintenance.
  • Familiarity with load and performance testing tools such as JMeter, K6, or Locust, with the ability to identify performance bottlenecks and suggest improvements.
  • Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Contact Information: careers@way.com

job_description:
Infrastructure Engineer

Timesworld Media and Technology Solutions (P) Ltd is seeking a seasoned IT Infrastructure Engineer to drive modern infrastructure transformation. This role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining scalable, secure, and resilient IT environments, focusing on adopting emerging technologies.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and enhance enterprise-grade infrastructure solutions across on-premises and cloud environments.
  • Evaluate and optimize current systems, ensuring compliance with security standards, scalability, and operational efficiency.
  • Manage virtual networks, resolve connectivity issues, and implement redundancy strategies for high availability across locations.
  • Administer and monitor operating systems, middleware, automated workflows, and server virtualization platforms.
  • Collaborate with development teams to support application deployment, testing, and performance tuning across multiple environments.
  • Lead containerization initiatives using Docker, Kubernetes, or similar platforms to streamline application delivery.
  • Support DevOps and DevSecOps processes including CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code (IaC), and automated security testing.
  • Monitor infrastructure performance and proactively identify areas for improvement in systems, networks, applications, and databases.
  • Maintain and evolve build and release processes, ensuring secure promotion of infrastructure components from development to production.
  • Deploy and manage hybrid cloud environments including public, private, and AI-enabled cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Implement secure system configurations and manage inter-application data flows in alignment with data protection regulations.
  • Provide architectural input during project planning and ensure technical alignment with business goals.
  • Share expertise across teams and support cross-functional programs and initiatives.
  • Stay updated on emerging trends in cloud computing, automation, AI infrastructure, and cyber-resilience.

Requirements:

  • 3 to 4 years of professional experience in enterprise IT infrastructure roles.
  • Proven experience with modern infrastructure design including server, storage, networking, virtualization, and cloud-native services.
  • Strong hands-on experience with DevOps, CI/CD tools (e.g., GitLab, Jenkins, Azure DevOps), and IaC tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience with containerization platforms (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration in hybrid/multi-cloud environments.
  • Familiarity with AI/ML workloads and infrastructure components used in AI Cloud environments is an advantage.
  • Working knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their architecture best practices.
  • Deep understanding of IT security principles, compliance frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001), and secure system architecture.
  • Proficiency in managing and optimizing network topologies, firewalls, VPNs, and access controls.
  • Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to align infrastructure design with business strategy.
  • Experience in architecture governance, standards development, and delivery lifecycle optimization.
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Industry certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Architect, Kubernetes Administrator, CISSP) are a plus.

Contact Information:

  • Email: hr.tvm@timesworld.com
  • Website: https://www.timesworld.com/careers/infrastructure-engineer

Closing Date: 16, Aug 2025
summary: Timesworld is hiring an Infrastructure Engineer to design and maintain scalable IT environments. The candidate will focus on cloud platforms, container orchestration, and DevOps practices.

job_description:
Content QA Specialist

Way Dot Com (P) Ltd is seeking a meticulous and quality-driven Content QA Specialist to join our dynamic content team. This role goes beyond traditional proofreading—you will act as the final gatekeeper before content is published, ensuring it meets the highest standards of accuracy, SEO performance, compliance, and brand integrity.

As a Content QA Specialist, you will perform comprehensive manual reviews to identify low-quality, AI-generated, or non-compliant content, ensuring alignment with Google’s EEAT (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trustworthiness) principles and SEO best practices.

Key Responsibilities

Content Review & Editorial Consistency

  • Conduct in-depth audits of articles, blogs, and landing pages to ensure grammatical accuracy, tone consistency, clarity, and alignment with brand voice.
  • Identify and correct issues such as awkward phrasing, factual errors, formatting inconsistencies, and overall editorial deficiencies.

SEO & Content Quality Validation

  • Review on-page SEO elements including meta tags, header structure, keyword usage, and internal linking for accuracy and effectiveness.
  • Assess content for originality, depth, and relevance, flagging material that lacks insight, utility, or user value.

AI & Plagiarism Detection

  • Use a combination of manual review techniques and detection tools to identify AI-generated or machine-written content.
  • Perform plagiarism checks to ensure content originality and alignment with brand and ethical standards.

EEAT Compliance & Credibility Assessment

  • Verify author credentials and assess the credibility of sources used.
  • Evaluate content for factual accuracy and subject matter authority, especially in high-stakes areas like finance, health, or other YMYL (Your Money or Your Life) categories.

Quality Assurance & Process Optimization

  • Maintain and continuously update QA checklists and content quality benchmarks in line with evolving industry standards.
  • Deliver constructive feedback to writers and editors to enhance content quality and uphold editorial excellence.

Preferred Skills/Requirements

job_description:

Way.com is seeking a visionary and experienced Engineering Manager to lead our Mobile Engineering Team in delivering high-impact projects across our innovative automotive technology platform. This role combines strategic technical leadership with team management, playing a critical part in defining the future of mobility at Way.com.

At Way.com, we’re on a mission to transform how people park, commute, and manage their vehicles. Operating in a fast-paced, innovation-driven environment, we prioritize accountability, customer-centricity, and forward-thinking solutions. Join a passionate team dedicated to reshaping the automotive experience and simplifying everyday travel.

job_description:
Senior Engineer - QA

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Senior QA Automation Engineer with a strong foundation in Java-based test automation. The ideal candidate will bring 5+ years of experience in building and maintaining scalable automation frameworks, with deep expertise in Core Java, Selenium WebDriver, and REST API testing using Rest Assured.

This role demands a strategic mindset, the ability to translate complex business needs into effective test solutions, and strong collaboration with cross-functional teams. Success in this role is driven by technical proficiency, clear communication, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.

Key Responsibilities

  • Translate complex business requirements into comprehensive test strategies and detailed test plans.
  • Design, build, and maintain scalable, reusable test automation frameworks using Java.
  • Collaborate with product managers, developers, and QA engineers to ensure quality across the software development lifecycle.
  • Execute thorough end-to-end functional testing to validate system behavior and ensure alignment with business objectives.
  • Create and maintain automated test scripts for both web applications and APIs using Selenium WebDriver and Rest Assured.
  • Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins) to support continuous testing and rapid release cycles.
  • Monitor, diagnose, and resolve automation issues, providing timely and actionable feedback to development teams.
  • Uphold high standards in test case design, automation code quality, and QA documentation.
  • Analyze test outcomes, report defects, and work closely with developers for quick and effective resolution.

Preferred Skills

  • 5+ years of experience in test automation using Java.
  • Strong knowledge of Core Java, including object-oriented principles, exception handling, multi-threading, and file handling.
  • Proficiency in Java Collections (Lists, Sets, Maps, Queues) and solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
  • Hands-on experience with Selenium WebDriver, including dynamic element handling, custom wait strategies, and cross-browser compatibility.
  • Proficient in REST API testing using Rest Assured, covering request modeling, authentication, and API validation.
  • Experience with Jenkins or similar CI/CD tools for test suite integration and automation pipeline maintenance.
  • Familiarity with load and performance testing tools such as JMeter, K6, or Locust, with the ability to identify performance bottlenecks and suggest improvements.
  • Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Contact Information

Way.Com India Pvt Ltd 4th Floor, Yamuna, Technopark Phase-III, Thiruvananthapuram, 695583 careers@way.com http://www.way.com

job_description:
DevOps Engineer

Prophaze Technologies (P) Ltd is seeking a DevOps Engineer to join our team. You will be responsible for building and managing secure, scalable, and high-availability infrastructure to support WAF services and microservice deployments.

Location: 4th Floor, Padmanabham, Technopark Campus, Kazhakuttom Trivandrum, Kerala 695581, 695581

Website: https://prophaze.com

Closing Date: 29, Aug 2025

Job Published: 28, July 2025

Contact Email: ammu.suresh@prophaze

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines for WAF components and internal cloud services.
  • Provision and administer AWS EC2 instances, EBS volumes, and associated VM resources.
  • Configure and maintain AWS Load Balancers (ALB/NLB), listener rules, target groups, and TLS termination.
  • Set up and troubleshoot DNS records, zones, and routing policies using Route 53 or equivalent DNS services.
  • Deploy and manage services on Kubernetes (EKS, GKE, AKS, or self-hosted clusters).
  • Automate infrastructure using Terraform, Helm, and Ansible.
  • Manage web server configurations (NGINX, Apache) including reverse proxy, SSL, and request routing.
  • Handle TLS/SSL certificate management and traffic encryption.
  • Monitor infrastructure with Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch, or ELK stack.
  • Collaborate with security teams to implement WAF rules, hardening, and DevSecOps best practices.
  • Participate in incident response, troubleshooting, and RCA documentation.

Required Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in DevOps, SRE, or Infrastructure Engineering.
  • Proficient in managing AWS EC2, Load Balancers, and cloud VM provisioning.
  • Solid knowledge of DNS, routing concepts, and basic network troubleshooting.
  • Experience configuring NGINX and Apache web servers (reverse proxy, SSL, performance tuning).
  • Strong hands-on experience with Kubernetes, Docker, and containerized microservices.
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform, Helm, and Ansible.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools like GitLab CI, Jenkins, or ArgoCD.
  • Scripting in Bash, Python, or Go.

Preferred Qualifications (Nice to Have):

  • Experience configuring or deploying Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) such as Prophaze, ModSecurity, or AWS WAF.
  • Familiarity with OWASP Top 10, container hardening, and CVE mitigation tools (Trivy, ZAP, etc.).
  • Exposure to DevSecOps practices and multi-tenant SaaS environments.

Relevant Certifications:

  • AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate or Professional
  • AWS Certified DevOps Engineer
  • Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA)
  • Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)

Why Join Us:

  • Build next-gen cloud infrastructure powering cutting-edge WAF technology.
  • Work with a collaborative and fast-paced DevSecOps team.
  • Flexible remote environment with opportunities for certification and upskilling.
  • Directly influence performance, security, and scalability of core systems.
summary: Prophaze Technologies is looking for a DevOps Engineer to manage their cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines. The ideal candidate will have strong AWS, Kubernetes, and automation skills.
